user_text: I'm in the mood for a comedy-drama movie. Could you recommend a few?
system_text:
I think I have just the right recommendations for you!

If you're in the mood for a heartwarming and uplifting comedy-drama, I'd highly recommend "Real Women Have Curves" (2002). This film tells the relatable story of an 18-year-old Mexican-American girl navigating her identity and aspirations amidst family expectations. With strong performances from America Ferrera and Lupe Ontiveros, this movie is a great choice for anyone looking for a feel-good story.

If you're in the mood for something a bit more light-hearted and action-packed, I think "21 Jump Street" (2012) could be just what you need! This hilarious buddy cop comedy stars Channing Tatum and Jonah Hill as two mismatched police officers going undercover at their old high school.

1. "It's a Wonderful Life" (1946) directed by Frank Capra:
Starring: Lionel Barrymore, Gloria Grahame, John Forsythe, Thomas Mitchell.
Plot Outline: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

2. "Paycheck" (2003) directed by Stephen Sommers:
Starring: Ryan Robbins, Krista Allen, Joe Morton, Joe Morton, Colm Feore, Ben Affleck, Kathryn Morris, Ivana Milicevic, Callum Rennie.
Plot Outline: Harry' s dead and, while no one really minds, everyone feels responsible. After Harry' s body is found in the woods, several locals must determine not only how and why he was killed but what to do with the body.

3. "You" (2014) directed by David Fincher:
Starring: Leonardo DiCaprio, Will Smith, Jessica Chastain, Ryan Gosling.
Plot Outline: After a failed relationship, a young man named Thomas (Leonardo DiCaprio) becomes obsessed with finding out who his father is. He sets off on a journey that takes him to different parts of the United States, and he meets many people along the way who help him in various ways.
